acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours EC50=0.004microg/L of the crustacea (Amphipod) (EHC82, 1989).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality at doses of not more than 5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible since the available rat inhalation LC50 value of >0.25mg/L is not classifiable (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 195mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: The available carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice provide no evidence of treatment-related increase in the incidence of tumor formation, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986). Also due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group C by EPA.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=6.6 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available, whereas No data available on those with melting point of <55degC.

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3352 Pyrethroid Pesticide, liquid, toxic (ICSC (2004)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vitro reverse mutation tests, in vivo mouse dominant lethal tests and chinese hamster somatic cell chromosome aberration tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3352 Pyrethroid Pesticide, liquid, toxic (ICSC (2004)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproductive function/capacity and pup development observed in 2-generation reproduction studies in rats and gestation studies in rats and mice (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3352 Pyrethroid Pesticide, liquid, toxic (ICSC (2004)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation (the highest mean Draize score of 2.3) with effects fully reversible by 48 hours, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of local responses observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on no evidence of skin reactions observed in guinea pig skin sensitization studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including self-licking/biting, generalized tremors, rigid gait, ataxia, incoordination, hyperesthesia (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In the oral toxicity studies using rats or mouse, lethargy, sedation, ataxic gait, piloerection, vocalization, rolling, jumping, loose stool and stained fur have been observed with both males and females, and salivation has been observed only with males (Technical Reports for Agricultural Chemical Registration (1986)) within the guidance values for Category 1. So the substance was classified as Category 1 (nervous system) based on these results.
